title: Wisconsin man is charged after boy says he strapped him to chair in basement
text:
Nathan Pogrant, 36, was arrested on Monday and charged with false imprisonment and child abuse

A man has been charged after an 8-year-old was found on a highway claiming he escaped from the basement of his Eland, Wisconsin, home.

Police arrested 36-year-old Nathan Pogrant Monday on charges including false imprisonment and child abuse. The boy's relationship to Pogrant is unclear.

Prosecutors said the boy was found walking on Highway 45 on October 5 after he escaped from the basement when the adults were asleep.

He told police that as punishment Pogrant - who he said lives with him - put him in a makeshift straitjacket made from a hooded sweatshirt and then 'tied a cord around his body' with bike locks.

According to the complaint, investigators found several bruises on the boy's face and body.

The boy told police that he urinated on himself after Pogrant left him tied to the chair for at least two nights and a day.

He also added that his mother and Pogrant would 'turn off the lights and turn up the music so they wouldn't hear him crying.'

An 8-year-old boy was found on a highway on October 5 after he escaped from his basement in Wisconsin claiming Pogrant had abused him

He told police that he urinated on himself after Pogrant left him tied to the chair for at least two nights and a day

The boy told authorities that he had only been fed a peanut butter sandwich the entire day.

The complaint obtained by WISN said that when he tried to get more food, 'Nathan told him that they would break his fingers if he steals more food.'

Pogrant is held on $25,000 cash bond.

The boy's mother has not been charged. She told police she was afraid Pogrant might hurt her.

Pogrant has a history of crimes against children and is listed on the sex offender registry, however the complaint does not suggest the boy was sexually assaulted (pictured in a previous mugshot)

When asked why it happened and why she didn't stop the abuse, the complaint said the boy's mother replied, 'I don't know.'

Pogrant has a history of crimes against children and is listed on the sex offender registry, however the complaint does not suggest the boy was sexually assaulted.

He's facing 12 counts in the 18-page complaint and if convicted could spend the rest of his life in prison.
description: An 8-year-old boy was found on a highway on October 5 after he escaped from his basement in Eland, Wisconsin. Nathan Pogrant, 36, was arrested and charged with abuse.
